intro: Anthospermum lanceolatum var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
